column4: In 10.10, When I change my resolution to 1440x900 the top and bottom panels are gone, but i appears when i change it back to 1024x768. Why is that? i have an intel i915GM on Dell inspiron 640m
ubottu: do i have to do this everytime i change resolution?
ubottu: btw the icons on my desktop just flickered then no panels appeared...
When I plug in external monitor to the laptop or second monitor, panels (and positions) often can be found shuffled around.
that's it... i'm using an external monitor also and it doesn't appear even if i tried using those commands
Well, either way. I wonder if your laptop's graphic card is powerful enough to manage both displays?
I'll try the suggestion of Dr_Willis to make it the default display... will be back...
Dr_Willis: We made it! I switched off the monitor of laptop in gnome-control-center and the panels appeared! Thanks guys!
man wget or "wget --help" in the terminal.
i wonder if wget can fork then accelerate download
